column4: i forgot how to do this... but i can't see my windows shared folder in the ubuntu side of samba...
places -> connect to server

you want to connect from your ubuntu box to a Windows share, yes?
i installed system-config-samba
yep... i can see the ubuntu shared folder in xp, but not the other way around
okay, on the ubuntu box, go to the Places menu, and select Connect to Server
'service type' would ve Windows Share
and the rest?

'Server' would be the address of your server (e. g. 192.168.1.5'), 'share' is the name of the share, 'folder' is the subdirectory of the share you want to mount, usename is, well, the username, and the domain is the domain (or the workgroup) of the Windows box
oh.. i have to know the ip of the other system now?
you always need to know what you're connecting *to* when you're making these sorts of connections
how come it used to be that i just configure it and then on ubuntu, go to places>network and then the workgroup computers would appear there...

you could try places -> network, but it's a lot easier if you know the info that you fill into the 'connect to server' box, at least for me.  As always, there's more than one way to skin a metaphorical cat
